page.title: 02Local history
page.content: The pace of life in Shevington since 1946 has changed markedly. Then, children could play games on the road such as tennis, football and racing. When traffic started to increase, traffic patrol groups, lollipop ladies and police started helping. As housing increased the lovely countyrside views were obstructed and as the fields were reduced so were the numbers of safe play areas. Then, rates were Â£11.12s.0.5d., and in wages an engineer could earn Â£3. You could now multiply these amounts by 50 or more. After school boys would help on a farm, now there are only about 4 farms left. As a pastime they could also listen to the radio or play the piano, now they watch TV or play with a computer.
